channel.title: Npc won't spawn? [RandQm Blank source]
channel.description:
I've been having problems spawning npcs into the server, I must be doing something wrong. My autospawn.config is set up in the following manner. I am assuming that ID = Npc Id, the 0 after that is the height of the server, the coords are where the npc is going to be positioned and the X Y X Y is the area of which an npc would be restricted to when walking and ofcourse the walktype is what type of walking the npc does, which I leave at 1 (it stands still, I assume).
//spawn = ID 0 coordX coordY X Y X Y walktype spawn = 2883 0 3218 3431 0 0 0 0 1 [ENDOFSPAWNLIST]
This is the line of which I placed in.
spawn = 2883 0 3218 3431 0 0 0 0 1
Is there anything wrong with it? the spawn is pretty much at Varrock fountain. I compile and run my server, load up the client, log in.. but there is no monster at the fountain.

item.title: Npc won't spawn? [RandQm Blank source]
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

I’ve found out the problem. The template for autospawn was not setup correctly. the height number is meant to be placed after the coords, as opposed to the template indicating it is to be placed BEFORE.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc won't spawn? [RandQm Blank source]

item.description:
@nerd123456789 wrote:

hmm idk then sorry

Read full topic

item.title: Npc won't spawn? [RandQm Blank source]
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

Well, it is just called Autospawn. But I tried renaming it simply, “Spawn” and when I tried to run the server I was told that the autospawn.cfg file could not be found. So, I believe changing the name of the file is the solution to this problem.

Read full topic
